subject: Parenting
title: The Self-Esteem Movement
description: A quick, practical guide to The Self-Esteem Movement.

hook.text: In the 1980s, every child got a trophy. The goal was self-esteem. The result was fragility.

buildup.text: The self-esteem movement believed that praising children unconditionally would produce confident adults.

discovery.text: It was based on correlational studies: high achievers had high self-esteem, so boost esteem, boost achievement.

twist.text: The logic was backwards. Achievement builds self-esteem â€” not the other way around.

climax.text: Inflated praise without earned competence produced children afraid to fail or try hard things.

punchline.text: Self-esteem can't be given. It can only be earned through experience.

quiz.question: What went wrong with the self-esteem movement's approach?
